qas.question: Bell and his assistant first used their photophone on what date?
How many feet did the first photophone message travel?
From what building was the first photophone message sent?
How many years after this photophone message would the first message take place over radio?

context: On <a0_0>June 21, 1880<a0_0/>, Bell's assistant transmitted a wireless voice telephone message a considerable distance, from the roof of the <a2_0>Franklin School<a2_0/> in Washington, D.C., to Bell at the window of his laboratory, some 213 metres (<a1_0>700<a1_0/> ft) away, <a3_0>19<a3_0/> years before the first voice radio transmissions.
